awd_abstract_narration: It is proposed to address fundamental theoretical questions                about the generation of nonclassical optical fields, their                      interactions with matter, and methods for conceptualizing and                   giving mathematical description to their nonclassical properties.               Here the electromagnetic field is viewed as an essentially                      statistical quantity.  The hope is to achieve a better                          understanding of the conceptual and theoretical interface between               the classical and quantum-mechanical worlds.  Areas of work will                include (1) intracavity atom-field interactions, (2) single-atom                optical bi stability, (3) atomic interactions with nonclassical                 light, and (4) the theory of nonlinear quantum dissipative                      systems
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
